metadata.title: CVE-2020-27067 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS-updates 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
In the l2tp subsystem, there is a possible use after free due to a racecondition. This could lead to local escalation of privilege with Systemexecution privileges needed. User interaction is not needed forexploitation.Product: AndroidVersions: Android kernelAndroid ID:A-152409173

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-27067` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.15.0-10-generic - 4.15.0-10.11
linux-image-4.15.0-10-generic-lpae - 4.15.0-10.11
linux-image-4.15.0-10-lowlatency - 4.15.0-10.11
linux-image-extra-4.15.0-10-generic - 4.15.0-10.11
No subscription required

linux-image-5.4.0-37-generic - 5.4.0-37.41~18.04.1

criterions.comment: linux package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-10.11').
